definition: bawu, a free reed wind instrument shaped like a flute and played transversally, associated particularly with minority cultures of Yunnan
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu

sentences.english: She was assisted in the management of her vast property by her son-in-law Mathur Mohan.
sentences.chinese: 她被女婿马图尔巴乌任命去协助管理巨大的财富。

definition: hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
